en: Mary was wearing a black sweater when I met her.
zh: 我见到玛丽的时候，她穿着一件黑毛衣。

en: I'm through with Mary.
zh: 我和玛丽吹了。

en: How did you get to know Mary?
zh: 你是怎么认识玛丽的？

en: Mary and John quarreled, but made up after a while.
zh: 玛丽和约翰吵了一架，但过会儿就和好了。

en: There was no one in the room besides Mary and John.
zh: 房间里除了玛丽和约翰，没别人。

en: Mary. That's my name.
zh: 玛丽。我就是这个名字。

en: Mary had every reason to be satisfied.
zh: 玛丽完全有理由感到满意。

en: Until Mary gets back to work, we'll have to make do with Ken.
zh: 在玛丽回来上班之前，我们只能先让肯凑合一下了。

en: When Mary saw him, a look of surprise spread across her face.
zh: 玛丽看到他时，一脸惊讶。

en: In came Mary.
zh: 玛丽进来了。

en: I'm keen on Mary passing the examination.
zh: 我特别希望玛丽能通过考试。

en: When Mary was a child, her family was dirt poor.
zh: 玛丽小时候，家里穷得叮当响。

en: I don't know what Mary is looking for.
zh: 我不知道玛丽在找什么。

en: I was astounded by the news that Mary won the first prize.
zh: 听到玛丽得了一等奖的消息，我惊呆了。

en: I see Mary playing the piano.
zh: 我看见玛丽在弹钢琴。

en: When Mary reached the bus stop, the last bus had already left.
zh: 玛丽到车站时，末班车已经开走了。

en: I didn't bargain for Mary's coming so soon.
zh: 我没料到玛丽会来得这么快。

en: It was yesterday that Mary bought this skirt.
zh: 玛丽这件裙子是昨天买的。

en: When was it that Mary bought this skirt?
zh: 玛丽这件裙子是什么时候买的？

en: Wherever Mary goes, the sheep follows her.
zh: 玛丽去哪儿，那只羊就跟到哪儿。

en: Either Mary or you is to go.
zh: 要么玛丽去，要么你去。

en: Mary, this is Joe's brother David.
zh: 玛丽，这是乔的哥哥大卫。

en: Of course you can trust me. Have I ever given you a bum steer before?
zh: 你当然可以信任我。我哪次坑过你？

en: The contract, if you were forced to sign it, is invalid.
zh: 要是这合同是被逼着签的，那是无效的。

en: Waste not, want not.
zh: 勤俭节约，吃穿不缺。

en: I would prefer an honorable death.
zh: 我宁愿光荣地死。

en: I would rather let him have his own way.
zh: 我宁愿让他按自己的想法来。

en: It seemed rather bad.
zh: 看起来挺糟糕的。

en: There goes a wonderful coach over there.
zh: 看，那边过去了一辆很棒的大巴车。

en: That bank over there would do the service.
zh: 那边那家银行能办这业务。

en: The girl standing over there is Mary.
zh: 站在那儿的那个女孩是玛丽。

en: The building you see over there is an auto factory.
zh: 你看那边那栋楼是个汽车厂。

en: We can see a church over there.
zh: 我们可以看到那边有个教堂。

en: The man reading a paper over there is my uncle.
zh: 在那边看报纸的那个人是我叔叔。

en: You're disgusting!
zh: 你真恶心！

en: Who is the boy that is swimming over there?
zh: 在那边游泳的那个男孩是谁？

en: Once upon a time, there was an old man in this village.
zh: 很久以前，这村子里有个老头。

en: I can't do the hard day's work I used to.
zh: 我现在干不动以前那种重活了。

en: Once upon a time, there lived an old man.
zh: 从前，住着一个老爷爷。

en: Where did Ming go to do her homework?
zh: 小明去哪儿写作业了？

en: Ming called her friend yesterday evening.
zh: 小明昨天晚上给她的朋友打过电话了。

en: Ming wasn't dancing with Masao then.
zh: 那会儿小明没在和正男跳舞。

en: Did Ming's father play tennis yesterday?
zh: 小明的爸爸昨天打网球了吗？

en: Is everybody ready for the trip?
zh: 大家都准备好去旅游了吗？

en: People don't like to swim against the tide.
zh: 大家都不喜欢逆流而行。

en: All were silent.
zh: 大家都没说话。

en: Everybody puts me down.
zh: 谁都瞧不起我。

en: You can't just lounge around like that while everybody else is so busy.
zh: 大家都忙得要命，你不能就这么在那儿闲晃。

en: Everyone marvelled at her courage.
zh: 大家都对她的勇气感到惊叹。

en: Everyone hoped that she would win.
zh: 大家都希望她能赢。

en: Everyone is friendly to her.
zh: 大家都对她挺友好的。

en: Everybody calls him Mac.
zh: 大家都管他叫 Mac。

en: Everybody was thrilled by his story.
zh: 大家都对他讲的故事感到很兴奋。

en: Everyone speaks highly of him.
zh: 大家都对他评价挺高的。

en: All sold out!
zh: 全卖光了！

en: Everybody burst into laughter.
zh: 大家都哄堂大笑。

en: Everyone has a character of his own.
zh: 每个人都有自己的性格。

en: They are all the same.
zh: 他们都一个样。

en: We are all suspicious about him.
zh: 我们都觉得他挺可疑的。

en: There are some cookies in the jar.
zh: 罐子里有几块饼干。

en: I hope all of them will come in time.
zh: 我希望他们都能准时到。

en: Everybody put their foot down.
zh: 大家都态度坚决。

en: They were all hoarse from shouting.
zh: 他们嗓子都喊哑了。

en: Everybody washed in the kitchen.
zh: 大家都去厨房洗了。

en: They all have arms, legs, and heads, they walk and talk, but now there's SOMETHING that wants to make them different.
zh: 他们也都有胳膊有腿有脑袋，会走路也会说话，可现在偏偏有什么东西想让他们变得不一样。

en: We all have missed you.
zh: 我们都挺想你的。

en: We all like cycling.
zh: 我们都喜欢骑行。

en: All are happy.
zh: 大家都挺开心的。

en: Get to work, everybody.
zh: 大家开工吧。

en: Nobody likes it.
zh: 没人喜欢那个。

en: Everybody praised her to the skies.
zh: 大家都把她夸到天上去了。

en: I don't like any of them.
zh: 我哪个都不喜欢。

en: Everybody agrees with you.
zh: 大家都同意你的看法。

en: Everybody is waiting for you.
zh: 大家都在等你呢。

en: We thought that you were married.
zh: 我们还以为你已经结婚了。

en: They are all irritable.
zh: 他们一个个脾气都挺冲的。

en: Everybody started waving his flag.
zh: 大家都挥舞起旗子来。

en: Does everybody love music?
zh: 大家都喜欢音乐吗？

en: Let's pretend we are aliens.
zh: 咱们假装是外星人吧。

en: Read after me all together.
zh: 大家跟我一起读。

en: It is difficult to satisfy everyone.
zh: 很难让每个人都满意。

en: Everyone loves Mac.
zh: 大家都喜欢 Mac。

en: They were all charmed by her song.
zh: 大家都给她的歌声迷住了。

en: Everyone calls him Jeff.
zh: 大家都叫他 Jeff。

en: They were most attentive to his speech.
zh: 他们听他讲话时都特别专心。

en: Everybody sang at the top of their lungs.
zh: 大家都扯着嗓子唱歌。

en: Everybody called me Tony in those days.
zh: 那时候大家都管我叫 Tony。

en: They made little of my effort to make our class enjoyable.
zh: 他们对我为了让课堂变得有趣所做的努力根本不在乎。

en: Everybody calls the small cat Tora.
zh: 大家都管那只小猫叫 Tora。

en: By all accounts, it is truth.
zh: 从各方面来看，这都是事实。

en: In many parts of the world, there is not enough food to meet everyone's needs.
zh: 在世界上很多地方，食物还不够满足每个人的需求。

en: Who is the tallest of all?
zh: 谁是个子最高的？

en: Everybody's fault is nobody's fault.
zh: 大家都犯的错就不算谁的错了。

en: I remembered everybody.
zh: 我记住了每一个人。

en: You can not be rude to everyone and expect to get away with it forever.
zh: 你不能对谁都那么粗鲁，还指望能一直相安无事。

en: Please read it aloud so that everyone can hear.
zh: 请大声读出来，让大家都能听见。

en: Speak louder so everyone can hear you.
zh: 大点儿声，好让大家都能听见你说话。

en: I spoke loudly so that everyone could hear me.
zh: 我大声说话是为了让大家都能听见。

en: Go along with the crowd.
zh: 随大流吧。

en: I think that everybody knows.
zh: 我觉得大家都知道了。

en: There's enough food to go round.
zh: 菜够吃的，大家都有份。

en: I have wonderful news for all of you.
zh: 我有个好消息要告诉大家。

en: Let's play baseball with everyone.
zh: 我们和大家一起打棒球吧。

en: Would you like to join us for a game of cards?
zh: 想跟我们一起打牌吗？

en: We're all going to share it. Could you bring us some extra plates?
zh: 我们大家分着吃，能再拿几个盘子过来吗？

en: I was left out in the cold by everyone.
zh: 大家都把我给晾在一边了。

en: Hey, what's the big secret? Come on; let me in on it.
zh: 嘿，什么秘密啊？快点，也跟我说说。

en: All of us are working on the case.
zh: 我们大家都在跟这个案子。

en: We raced our beetles.
zh: 我们让各自的甲虫赛跑。

en: Sit at the table.
zh: 坐到桌子这儿。

en: Everybody was going about his business.
zh: 每个人都在忙各自的事。

en: All of us approved of the plan.
zh: 我们大家都赞成这个计划。

en: Everybody pulled their socks up, yeah.
zh: 大家都加把劲了。

en: Everyone went there, didn't they?
zh: 大家都去那儿了，对吧？

en: Everyone thinks so.
zh: 大家都这么想。

en: Everyone hoped for a snow flurry for Christmas.
zh: 大家都盼着圣诞节能下一场雪。

en: We found that everyone was asleep.
zh: 我们发现大家都睡着了。

en: Everyone attacked my opinion.
zh: 大家都批驳了我的观点。

en: Not all of us catch colds.
zh: 不是我们所有人都会感冒。

en: Please speak more loudly so that everybody can hear you.
zh: 请大声点说，好让大家都能听见。

en: Everyone cheered his name.
zh: 大家都在欢呼他的名字。

en: Everybody wants to sit beside her.
zh: 大家都想坐在她旁边。

en: Everyone admires the pictures painted by him.
zh: 大家都非常欣赏他画的画。

en: Everyone is waiting to see his new film.
zh: 大家都在等着看他的新电影。

en: Everybody agreed with his idea.
zh: 大家都赞成他的想法。

en: Everybody laughed at his error.
zh: 大家都笑话他犯的错。

en: Everybody speaks well of him.
zh: 大家对他评价都很高。

en: Every one opposed it, but Mary and John got married all the same.
zh: 每个人都反对，但玛丽和约翰还是结婚了。

en: All are interested in Japan.
zh: 大家对日本都很感兴趣。

en: Everyone burst into laughter.
zh: 大家都哄堂大笑。

en: Everyone thinks the same thing.
zh: 大家的想法都一样。

en: Unless everyone plays well, we may lose the game.
zh: 除非大家都好好打，不然我们可能会输。

en: Everybody was jealous of my success.
zh: 大家都嫉妒我的成功。

en: Are there enough chairs to go around?
zh: 椅子够大家坐吗？

en: To everyone's astonishment, Mike won first prize in the speech contest.
zh: 让大家吃惊的是，麦克居然在演讲比赛中得了一等奖。

en: All the people felt for the victims deeply.
zh: 大家都非常同情受害者。

en: There will be chaos unless we all adhere to the rules.
zh: 除非我们都遵守规则，不然会乱套的。

en: Finish your homework by the time they return.
zh: 在他们回来之前把作业写完。

en: All were happy.
zh: 大家都很开心。

en: I got a farewell present from everyone.
zh: 我收到了大家送我的离别礼物。

en: Everybody looks up to Henry.
zh: 大家都挺敬佩亨利的。

en: Everyone considers Nomo a great pitcher.
zh: 大家都觉得野茂是个了不起的投球手。

en: Everyone was listening very carefully.
zh: 每个人都在非常仔细地听。

en: Everybody arrived dressed in their smartest clothes.
zh: 大家来的时候都穿着最体面的衣服。

en: Everybody praised Ken for his great courage.
zh: 大家都称赞肯很有勇气。

en: We all held our breath while we watched it.
zh: 我们看的时候都屏住了呼吸。

en: Everyone always asks me that.
zh: 大家都老是问我那个问题。

en: They call it "Gold-going Week".
zh: 他们管这叫“黄金周”。

en: Everybody is very busy getting ready for the New Year.
zh: 大家都在忙着准备过年。

en: Everyone always speaks well of Tony.
zh: 大家总是夸奖托尼。

en: Everybody had a good year.
zh: 大家都过得挺好的。

en: Everyone formed couples and began dancing.
zh: 大家都两两配对跳起舞来。

en: Boys! Now listen.
zh: 小伙子们，听好了。

en: Everyone was really impressed with that machine.
zh: 大家都对那台机器印象特别深刻。

en: When the Venus de Milo was entire, there were arms on the statue.
zh: 断臂维纳斯还没断的时候是有胳膊的。

en: The Venus de Milo is the perfection of beauty.
zh: 断臂维纳斯是美的化身。

en: Milton is one of the classic writers.
zh: 弥尔顿是古典作家之一。

en: Have you ever read Milton's works?
zh: 你读过弥尔顿的作品吗？

en: Such poets as Milton are rare.
zh: 像弥尔顿这样的诗人很难得。

en: Will you warm the milk, please?
zh: 能帮我热一下牛奶吗？

en: Drink up your milk.
zh: 把牛奶喝光。

en: Please give me a glass of milk.
zh: 请给我一杯牛奶。

en: Have a cup of milk. It will do you good.
zh: 喝杯牛奶吧，对身体有好处。

en: Will you give me a glass of milk?
zh: 能给我一杯牛奶吗？

en: Will you give me another glass of milk?
zh: 能再给我一杯牛奶吗？

en: Get me a glass of milk.
zh: 给我拿杯牛奶。

en: Would you like a cup of milk?
zh: 你想喝杯牛奶吗？

en: All of the milk was spilled.
zh: 牛奶全洒了。

en: Milk nourishes a baby.
zh: 牛奶对宝宝很有营养。

en: Milk is of great value to babies.
zh: 牛奶对婴儿非常有价值。

en: There isn't any milk left.
zh: 牛奶一点都不剩了。

en: How about some milk?
zh: 喝点牛奶怎么样？

en: I want three sugars in my milk.
zh: 我牛奶里要加三块糖。

en: I have an allergy to milk.
zh: 我对牛奶过敏。

en: My older sister often drinks tea with milk.
zh: 我姐姐经常喝加了奶的茶。

en: Where is the milk tea?
zh: 奶茶在哪儿？

en: I want some milk, but there isn't any in the refrigerator.
zh: 我想喝点牛奶，但冰箱里没有了。

en: The milk boiled over.
zh: 牛奶煮开溢出来了。

en: The milk went sour.
zh: 牛奶变酸了。

en: Cheese is made from milk.
zh: 奶酪是用牛奶做的。

en: Dr. Miller wants you to wait for a while.
zh: 米勒医生想让你等一会儿。

en: A Mr Miller wants to see you.
zh: 有位米勒先生想见你。

en: What's playing at the Music Box Theater?
zh: 八音盒剧院在演什么？

en: Didn't you see the musical?
zh: 你没看那个音乐剧吗？

en: Some people say stepping on a worm makes it rain.
zh: 有人说踩到蚯蚓就会下雨。

en: Worms are sometimes beneficial to soil.
zh: 蚯蚓有时对土壤有好处。

en: Miho is the girl I like best.
zh: 美穗是我最喜欢的女孩。

en: Miniskirts have gone out of fashion.
zh: 迷你裙已经过时了。

en: Miniskirts will soon come back.
zh: 迷你裙很快又会流行回来。

en: Do you think miniskirts will come back again?
zh: 你觉得迷你裙还会重新流行吗？

en: Mini-skirts are back in fashion again.
zh: 迷你裙又重新流行了。

en: Miniskirts have been out of date for some time.
zh: 迷你裙已经过时一阵子了。

en: Girls wearing mini-skirts, walking or sitting, are very effective eye-openers.
zh: 穿着迷你裙的女孩，不论走着还是坐着，都非常吸睛。

en: We should respect our parents.
zh: 我们应该孝顺父母。

en: They all looked happy.
zh: 他们看起来都很开心。

en: Everyone's eyes were fixed upon her.
zh: 大家的目光都集中在她身上。

en: Stay with me, ladies and gentlemen.
zh: 各位女士先生，请别走开。

en: Are you ready to eat?
zh: 准备好开饭了吗？

en: Could you keep still, everyone?
zh: 大家能别乱动吗？

en: You have certain privileges and therefore corresponding responsibilities.
zh: 你拥有一定的特权，因此也要承担相应的责任。

en: Please keep yourselves calm.
zh: 请大家保持冷静。

en: Listen, all of you.
zh: 大家都听好了。

en: I wish you all a merry Christmas and a happy new year.
zh: 祝大家圣诞快乐，新年快乐。

en: Order, please.
zh: 请安静。

en: You probably think she told me she was on her way to visit her sick grandmother.
zh: 你可能以为她告诉我她正要去探望生病的奶奶。

en: Now that we are all here, we can start the farewell party.
zh: 既然大家都到齐了，我们就开始欢送会吧。

en: Ladies and gentlemen, welcome aboard.
zh: 女士们、先生们，欢迎乘坐。

en: Ladies and gentlemen, due to an accident at the airport, our arrival will be delayed.
zh: 女士们、先生们，由于机场发生事故，我们将推迟抵达。

en: We hope you enjoy the movie.
zh: 希望大家喜欢这部电影。

en: Ladies and gentlemen, now we start the movie.
zh: 女士们、先生们，电影现在开始。

en: Everybody is relying on you.
zh: 大家都指望着你呢。

en: Not all were satisfied.
zh: 并不是所有人都满意。

en: Red, as opposed to green, is a sign of danger.
zh: 红色象征危险，而绿色则相反。

en: Was Midori skiing in Hokkaido then?
zh: 美登里那时候在北海道滑雪吗？

en: Bees make honey.
zh: 蜜蜂酿蜜。

en: Medium-rare and a potato, please.
zh: 五分熟，再要一份土豆。

en: Bees provide honey for us.
zh: 蜜蜂为我们提供蜂蜜。

en: Bees communicate the location of food by carrying odor samples back to the hive.
zh: 蜜蜂通过将气味样本带回蜂巢来传达食物的位置。

en: Look out for bees.
zh: 当心蜜蜂。

en: The bee alighted on the flower.
zh: 蜜蜂落在花朵上。

en: Mr Mitchel demanded that I pay the rest of the money by the end of the week.
zh: 米切尔先生要求我在本周末前付清余下的钱。

en: Mick killed time by reading a magazine while waiting for his date.
zh: 米克在等约会对象时看杂志来消磨时间。

en: Mick named the baby Richard.
zh: 米克给孩子起名叫理查德。

en: Mickey Conners made mincemeat of his opponent in the ring.
zh: 米奇·康纳斯在拳击场上把对手打得落花流水。

en: I love the taste when I bite into a juicy peach.
zh: 我很喜欢咬一口多汁桃子的那种味道。

en: Chicken pox is an itchy nuisance for kids.
zh: 水痘对孩子来说真是又痒又烦人。

en: My mistake cost me my fortune.
zh: 我的错误让我倾家荡产。

en: Mr. Children is very popular among young people.
zh: Mr. Children 在年轻人中非常受欢迎。

en: Never be afraid of making mistakes.
zh: 永远不要害怕犯错。

en: Apart from a few mistakes, your composition was excellent.
zh: 除了几处小错误，你的作文写得很棒。

en: A miserable sequence of defeats discouraged us.
zh: 一连串惨痛的失败让我们灰了心。

en: Unable to bear her miseries, she ran away from her husband.
zh: 她受不了那些痛苦，离开丈夫逃走了。

en: The Mississippi River flows into the Gulf of Mexico.
zh: 密西西比河注入墨西哥湾。

en: Mass is a Catholic ceremony of remembering Jesus Christ by eating and drinking.
zh: 弥撒是天主教纪念耶稣基督的一种仪式。

en: Do you ever hear anything about Misako?
zh: 你有美佐子的消息吗？

en: Misako married a Canadian last June.
zh: 美佐子去年六月和一个加拿大人结婚了。

en: Misato tried to be calm, but finally she lost her temper.
zh: 美里试着保持冷静，但最后还是发火了。

en: The missile attack took a heavy toll of lives.
zh: 导弹袭击造成了惨重的人员伤亡。

en: Michelangelo protested that he was not a painter.
zh: 米开朗基罗抗议说他不是画家。

en: So that Michelangelo might paint certain figures on the ceiling of the Sistine Chapel, so that Shakespeare might write certain speeches and Keats his poems, it seemed to me worthwhile that countless millions should have lived and suffered and died.
zh: 为了让米开朗基罗能在西斯廷小堂的穹顶上作画，为了让莎士比亚写出那些台词，为了让济慈写出他的诗篇，在我看来，哪怕千百万人为此生活、受苦和死去，也是值得的。

en: "Be quiet Mie," said Mother.
zh: “安静点，美惠，”母亲说。

en: I'd like meat loaf.
zh: 我想吃烘肉卷。

en: We have to call off the meeting.
zh: 我们得取消会议。

en: I'd like to call a meeting.
zh: 我想召集一次会议。

en: Please feel free to contact me for details about the meeting or the schedule.
zh: 有关会议或日程的详情，请随时联系我。

en: I need it by the morning of April 5, so it can be reviewed by other members prior to the meeting.
zh: 我需要在4月5号早上拿到，以便其他成员在开会前审阅。

en: Let me apologize once again for missing our meeting.
zh: 没能参加我们的会议，我再次表示歉意。

en: It's a fair cop.

en: I'd like a Manhattan.

en: "Manpower" is the world's largest temp agency.

zh: 曼哈顿金融区的一些交易所因为起火和停电缩短了工作时间。

en: It's on the mantelpiece.

en: The site of the condominium is enclosed with stakes.

en: Never having seen a mongoose, I do not know what they are like.

en: Stop beating around the bush.

en: Malaysia came into existence in 1957.

en: I can't sleep at all!

en: It seems as if everything he touches turns to gold.

en: The sky became as dark as if the sun had sunk.

en: It's just like walking on the moon.

en: Marina Giles left England with her husband in just this frame of mind.

en: Mariko speaks English excellently.
zh: 真理子的英语说得好极了。

en: Mariko's parents are strongly opposed to her marrying an American.
zh: 真理子的父母强烈反对她嫁给美国人。

en: Mulligan has been riding high since he seized the crown in a come-from-behind victory 14 months ago.

zh: 马利根说在比赛前他都能睡个安稳觉。

en: The marigold rises with the sun.

en: Maria spends a lot of money on clothes.
zh: 玛丽亚在衣服上花了很多钱。

en: Maria knew neither his name nor his phone number.
zh: 玛丽亚既不知道他的名字，也不知道他的电话号码。

en: Maria takes piano lessons once a week.
zh: 玛丽亚每周上一节钢琴课。

en: Maria's late husband was a violinist.

en: Malaria is carried by mosquitoes.

en: Malaria is a disease that mosquitoes carry.
zh: 疟疾是一种由蚊子携带的疾病。

en: At the beginning of a marathon race, scores of runners start, but only a few finish and just one takes the cake.
zh: 马拉松比赛开始时有很多选手，但只有少数人能跑完全程，而且只有一个人能夺魁。

en: The marathon will be held, rain or shine.
zh: 马拉松风雨无阻。

en: The marathon runners were out of breath.
zh: 跑马拉松的人都喘不过气来了。

en: Nobody fell behind in the marathon race.

en: The oil in mayonnaise sometimes separates from the other ingredients.
zh: 蛋黄酱里的油有时候会跟别的成分分层。

en: Mayuko was reading and Meg was painting.

en: Mayuko reads a good deal.

en: Mayuko entered the room.

en: Mayuko came up with him.

en: Mayuko eats bread for breakfast.

en: Mayuko ate up all the cookies.

en: Mayuko has not slept enough.

en: Mayuko can ride a bicycle.

en: Mayuko has sharp eyes.

en: Mayuko goes to school by bicycle.

en: Mayuko came running to meet us.

en: Mayuko made a fair copy of the draft.

en: Mayuko appears wise.

en: Mayuko is dancing to the music.

en: Mayuko failed to see Meg.

en: Mayuko has dropped the ball.

en: Mayuko came directly home.

en: Mayuko wiped a table with a cloth.

en: Mayuko jumped up in alarm.

en: Mayuko was tired to death.

en: Mayuko can't bear living alone.

en: Mayuko is good company.

en: Mayuko explained the rules in detail.

en: Mayuko argued for the plan.

en: Mayuko denied the rumor.

en: Mayuko looks cross.
zh: 真由子看起来气呼呼的。

en: Mayuko always wants the best.
zh: 真由子总是想要最好的。

en: Mayuko dreamed a strange dream.
zh: 真由子做了个奇怪的梦。

en: Mayuko's dream came true.

en: Mayuko always aims for perfection.

en: Mayuko came out of the room.

en: Mayuko cried aloud.

en: Maya priests learned much about astronomy.

en: Soon the same waiter came back to pick up the dishes.

en: We will take off in a few minutes.

en: Dinner will be ready soon.

en: I hope Father will come home from abroad soon.
zh: 我希望爸爸能快点从国外回来。

en: It will soon be possible for us to go direct to New York by air.

en: You will soon cease to think of her.

en: It was not long before she came back.

en: It was not long before they made their appearance.

en: It won't be long before he is up and about.

en: It was not long before he knew it.

en: You will soon hear from him.

en: It will not be long before he comes.

en: It will be winter before long.

en: It will clear up soon.

en: It won't be long before a warm spring comes.

en: It will not be long before the new term begins.

en: Soon the new year comes around.

en: The first snow came before long.

en: It will not be long before spring comes.

en: It will not be long before the cherry blossoms come out.

en: It won't be long before we can travel to the moon.

en: Before long, the moon came out.

en: It will not be long before business returns to normal.

en: We will have a music contest soon.

en: It will stop raining before long.

en: It will be dark soon.

en: As quick as a wink.

en: Let's get together and talk it over.

en: It is quite a sorry sight.

en: I agree completely.

en: You are quite right.

en: Quite by chance, I met my old friend at the airport.

en: It's really horrible.

en: I wrote to him for quite another reason.

en: It was a complete failure.

en: Look straight ahead.

en: Climbing the Matterhorn is difficult.
zh: 爬马特洪峰挺难的。

en: Look forward, please.

en: We have to clear up the problem first.

en: That's about it.

en: In the first place, you should be punctual.

en: First of all, you have to read this book.

en: First of all, may I have your name, please?

en: First, I'll try to understand why he thinks so.

en: Please fill out this form first.

en: Don't take it seriously.
zh: 别太当真了。

en: Don't take me seriously. I'm only joking.

en: Serious inquiries only, please.

zh: 胜声称自己是清白的。

en: Masaru wants to join the English Club.

en: He handled things wonderfully, playing it by ear the whole way. I have to say he did an excellent job.
zh: 他处理得太棒了，全程都在随机应变。不得不说，他干得确实出色。

en: It's really time something was done.

en: When I was on the point of leaving London, it began to snow.
zh: 我正准备离开伦敦的时候，就开始下雪了。

en: The very opposite is the truth.

en: That is well said.

en: That very tune reminded me of my adolescence.
zh: 就是那段曲子让我想起了我的青春。

zh: 正志和贵子在去哪儿度假的问题上产生了分歧。

en: It was quite possible to buy a house, just as it is in England, provided one gives up the idea of buying a home one likes, and at a reasonable price.
zh: 在那儿买房其实完全没问题，就像在英国一样，只要你放弃那种想用合理价格买到心仪房子的念头就行了。

en: Masako finished high school in Japan and then graduated from Harvard.
zh: 雅子在日本读完高中，然后从哈佛毕业了。

en: I hardly think she'd do that.
zh: 我觉得她不太可能做出那种事。

en: He was the last person I expected to see.
zh: 我怎么也没想到会见到他。

en: He hasn't come already, has he?

en: A friend in need is a friend indeed.

en: You must provide for a rainy day.
zh: 你得未雨绸缪。

en: He insured himself for a rainy day.
zh: 他为了以防万一给自己买了保险。

en: Save for a rainy day.

en: You should always save money for a rainy day.
zh: 你应该存点钱，以备不时之需。

en: You should save some money against a rainy day.

en: You should lay by something against a rainy day.
zh: 你应该存点东西，以备不时之需。

en: Please push this button at once in case of emergency.
zh: 遇到紧急情况，请立刻按下这个按钮。

en: I'll stand by you in time of need.
zh: 在你需要的时候，我会一直支持你的。

en: Keep something for a rainy day.
zh: 留点东西备用，以防万一。

en: In an emergency you can fall back on your savings.
zh: 万一出什么事，你还可以动用你的存款。

en: Believe it or not, she has three children.
zh: 信不信由你，她竟然有三个孩子。

en: I will not go to the length of saying such things.
zh: 我不至于说出那样的话来。

en: You are the last person I expected to see here.
zh: 真没想到会在这儿碰到你。

en: That wouldn't be the house we're looking for, surely.
zh: 那肯定不是我们要找的房子吧。

en: You must be kidding!
zh: 你开玩笑呢吧！

en: Masao won't come here, will he?
zh: 正男不会来这儿的，对吧？

en: Mother Teresa was given the Nobel prize.
zh: 特蕾莎修女获得了诺贝尔奖。

en: Mother Teresa was a Catholic nun who lived and worked in Calcutta, India.
zh: 特蕾莎修女是一位天主教修女，曾在印度加尔各答生活和工作。

en: Mother Teresa used the prize money for her work in India and around the world.
zh: 特蕾莎修女将奖金用于她在印度和世界各地的慈善工作。

en: Mother Teresa was born in Yugoslavia in 1910.
zh: 特蕾莎修女1910年出生于南斯拉夫。

en: Mother Teresa began her work by looking around to see what was needed.
zh: 特蕾莎修女通过观察周围人的需求开始了她的工作。

en: Makoto found his true love on top of Ayers Rock. She's from Osaka.
zh: 诚在艾尔斯岩顶上找到了真爱，她来自大阪。

en: Would you be kind enough to put in a word for me?
zh: 能麻烦你帮我说两句好话吗？

en: Would you be good enough to do it for me?
zh: 能麻烦你帮我做一下吗？

en: The tuna catch is declining.
zh: 金枪鱼的捕获量正在减少。

en: Macbeth raised an army to attack his enemy.
zh: 麦克白集结了一支军队去攻打他的敌人。

en: An earthquake of magnitude 5 shook Tokyo.
zh: 刚才东京发生了五级地震。

en: McDonald's is world-famous for its hamburgers.
zh: 麦当劳的汉堡闻名世界。

en: I'm working for McDonald's.
zh: 我在麦当劳打工。

en: What do you think about having breakfast at McDonald's?
zh: 去麦当劳吃早饭怎么样？

en: Maori culture is now spreading more and more among us and their language has become an official language.
zh: 毛利文化现在传播得越来越广，他们的语言也成了官方语言。

en: Mountain bike racing has caught on with young Japanese in the past few years.
zh: 在过去的几年里，山地车赛在日本年轻人中流行了起来。

en: The study by Meyer and his colleagues was unusual.
zh: 迈耶和同事们做的这项研究很不寻常。

en: A home is a once-in-a-lifetime purchase so you don't want to make any snap decisions.
zh: 买房是一辈子的大事，所以别急着做决定。

en: As a man sows, so he shall reap.
zh: 种瓜得瓜，种豆得豆。

en: You must reap what you have sown.
zh: 你自己种下的因，就得自己尝那个果。

en: You reap what you sow.
zh: 种瓜得瓜，种豆得豆。

en: Michael caught her by the hand.
zh: 迈克尔抓住了她的手。

en: Michael had a hard time making ends meet.
zh: 迈克尔那阵子很难维持生计。

en: Michael broke the dishes.
zh: 迈克尔把盘子摔碎了。

en: Michael is to be on a TV program tonight.
zh: 迈克尔今晚要上电视节目。

en: Michael was seen to leave by the side door.
zh: 有人看到迈克尔从侧门离开了。

en: Michael speaks Japanese, not to mention English.
zh: 迈克尔会说日语，更不用说英语了。

en: Michael Jackson is popular in the US.
zh: 迈克尔·杰克逊在美国很受欢迎。

en: Michael, this is the restaurant where your father and I had our first date.
zh: 迈克尔，这就是我和你爸爸第一次约会的餐厅。

en: All but Mike were present at the party.
zh: 除了迈克，大家都去参加派对了。

en: May I speak to Mike, please?
zh: 请问迈克在吗？

en: Microwaves penetrate the food in the oven.
zh: 微波会穿透烤箱里的食物。

en: I have installed Microsoft Office on my personal computer, so please use its file format when you send me the attachment.
zh: 我电脑上装了Office，所以发附件的时候请用它的格式。

en: I have attached a Microsoft Excel file.
zh: 我随信附上了一个Excel文件。

en: Mike has a nice racket.
zh: 迈克的球拍挺不错的。

en: Mike said that he would come.
zh: 迈克说他会来的。

en: It was pleasant for Mike to talk to Yumi.
zh: 迈克觉得和由美聊天挺愉快的。

en: Mike can't play baseball well.
zh: 迈克棒球打得不太好。

en: Mike is proud of his father being rich.
zh: 迈克为他爸爸很有钱而感到自豪。

en: They say that Mike is sick in bed.
zh: 听说迈克病得卧床不起。

en: Mike calls him Ned.
zh: 迈克叫他内德。

en: Mike is the youngest in his family.
zh: 迈克是家里年纪最小的。

en: Does Mike call his dog Pochi?

en: The microphone is live.
zh: 麦克风正开着呢。

en: Mike speaks good Japanese.
zh: 迈克的日语说得挺好的。

en: Mike earns no less than three hundred dollars a day.
zh: 迈克一天至少挣三百美元。

en: Mike wore an indignant look.
zh: 迈克一脸愤愤不平的样子。

en: Mike liked animals very much.
zh: 迈克非常喜欢动物。

en: Mike played a bad trick on his brother.
zh: 迈克对他弟弟搞了个恶作剧。

en: Mike has been making a model plane since breakfast.
zh: 迈克从早饭后就一直在做模型飞机。

en: Mike had his teeth checked last week.
zh: 迈克上周去检查牙齿了。

en: Is Mike a member of the swimming club?
zh: 迈克是游泳俱乐部的成员吗？

en: Mike got back from the library at five.
zh: 迈克五点从图书馆回来了。

en: Mike smiled.
zh: 迈克笑了笑。

en: Mike named his dog Spike.
zh: 迈克给他的狗起名叫斯派克。

en: Mike is captain of our team.
zh: 迈克是我们队的队长。

en: Though Mike likes his job very much, it does not pay well.
zh: 虽然迈克非常喜欢他的工作，但工资并不高。

en: Mike didn't join the practice yesterday.
zh: 迈克昨天没参加训练。

en: Mike ran very fast yesterday.
zh: 迈克昨天跑得飞快。

en: Mike doesn't have to wash his mother's car today.
zh: 迈克今天不用帮他妈妈洗车。

en: Mike is in the second year of high school and Ann is too.
zh: 迈克上高二，安也是。

en: Mike visited Mr Ogaki, who is our principal.
zh: 迈克拜访了我们的校长大垣先生。

en: Mike doesn't practice basketball on Monday.
zh: 迈克周一不练篮球。

en: Mike really thought your sister was something else.
zh: 迈克真的觉得你姐姐很不一般。

en: Mike was elected chairperson.
zh: 迈克被选为主席了。

en: Mike sings well.
zh: 迈克唱歌挺好听的。

en: Mike acted as chairperson of the meeting.
zh: 迈克担任了会议的主席。

en: Mike said a few words by way of suggestion.
zh: 迈克提了几句建议。

en: Mike eats out almost every night.
zh: 迈克几乎每天晚上都在外面吃。

en: Mike is one of our brains.
zh: 迈克是我们这儿的智囊之一。

en: Mike is not a member of the volleyball team.
zh: 迈克不是排球队的。

en: Mike goes to school by bus.
zh: 迈克坐公交车上学。

en: Mike likes to play basketball.
zh: 迈克喜欢打篮球。

en: Mike managed to carry the suitcase by himself.
zh: 迈克设法自己搬动了手提箱。

en: Mike was very kind. He got my car repaired for free.
zh: 迈克人挺好的，他免费帮我修了车。

en: Mike swims very well.
zh: 迈克游泳游得特别好。

en: Mike is popular among the girls because he is the star of the team.
zh: 迈克是队里的明星球员，所以在女生中很受欢迎。

en: Mike walked up to the boy.
zh: 迈克朝那个男孩走了过去。

en: Mike is the only man on the board.
zh: 迈克是董事会里唯一的男性。

en: Mike is the tallest of the three.
zh: 迈克是这三个人里最高的。

en: Mike is always nagging his father to buy him a car.
zh: 迈克老是磨着他爸爸给他买辆车。

en: Mike asked that he not be disturbed.
zh: 迈克要求不要被打扰。

en: Mike has a friend who lives in Chicago.
zh: 迈克有个朋友住在芝加哥。

en: Mike went to Kyoto last summer.
zh: 迈克去年夏天去了京都。

en: Mike has been out of work for a year.
zh: 迈克已经失业一年了。

en: Mike runs fastest in his class.
zh: 迈克是班里跑得最快的。

en: Is Mike off the bottle?
zh: 麦克戒酒了吗？

en: Mike is the brightest student in class.
zh: 麦克是班里最聪明的学生。

en: Mike always stays cool.
zh: 麦克总是很冷静。

en: Mike takes after his father in everything.
zh: 麦克各方面都很像他爸爸。

en: Mike said that he was very careless.
zh: 麦克说他当时太粗心了。

en: Mike made a rude table from the logs.
zh: 麦克用原木做了张简陋的桌子。

en: Mike could not keep up with his class.
zh: 麦克跟不上班里的进度。

en: What did you give Mike on his birthday?
zh: 麦克过生日你送他什么了？

en: Mike's job at home is cleaning the windows.
zh: 麦克在家负责擦窗户。

en: Mike's mother lived in a big city before she married.
zh: 麦克妈妈结婚前住在大城市。

en: According to Mike, Mac bought a new car.
zh: 听麦克说，马克买了辆新车。

en: Mike has a few friends in Florida.
zh: 麦克在佛罗里达有几个朋友。

en: Mike has two girl friends.
zh: 麦克有两个女朋友。

en: Mike and his sister can speak French, but they can't speak Japanese.
zh: 麦克和他妹妹会说法语，但不会说日语。

en: Mike and Tom are in the same class.
zh: 麦克和汤姆在同一个班。

en: Mike and David are always quarreling with each other over trifles.
zh: 麦克和戴维总为点鸡毛蒜皮的小事吵架。

en: Mike and Ken are friends.
zh: 麦克和肯是朋友。

en: This is Mike speaking. May I speak to Hiroshi, please?
zh: 我是麦克。请问浩史在吗？

en: Mike laughs.
zh: 麦克笑了。

en: It was this racket that Mike bought yesterday.
zh: 麦克昨天买的就是这个球拍。

en: It is clear that Mike took the wrong bus.
zh: 很明显，麦克坐错车了。

en: Mike cannot have done such a thing.
zh: 麦克不可能做这种事。

en: When Mike went to Jane's house, she was sleeping.
zh: 麦克去简家的时候，她正在睡觉。

en: It was yesterday that Mike bought this racket.
zh: 麦克是昨天买的这个球拍。

en: Mike, do planes usually rock like this?
zh: 麦克，飞机平时也这么晃吗？

en: You are wanted on the phone, Mike. It's Jane.
zh: 麦克，有你的电话。是简打来的。

en: Did you hear that, Mike?
zh: 麦克，你听到了吗？

en: How are you, Mike?
zh: 麦克，你最近怎么样？

en: Thanks, Mike. I don't like chicken.
zh: 谢了，麦克。我不爱吃鸡肉。

en: Well, you can't.
zh: 那可不行。

en: Well, it'll do for the time being.
zh: 行吧，暂时先这样。

en: That's fairly reasonable.
zh: 那还挺合理的。

en: You sure gab a lot don't you? You're a natural born talker.
zh: 你话可真够多的，天生就是个话匣子。

en: Martin seemed very tired, didn't he?
zh: 马丁看起来挺累的，是吧？

en: Martin Luther King, Jr., a man of peace, was killed by an assassin's bullet.
zh: 和平主义者马丁·路德·金被刺客暗杀了。

en: Martin Luther King, Jr. persuaded the black citizens to protest peacefully.
zh: 马丁·路德·金说服了黑人公民进行和平抗议。

en: Martin Luther King, Jr., had won his first protest against injustice - peacefully.
zh: 马丁·路德·金以和平方式赢得了他反抗不公的第一场抗议。

en: Martin Luther King, Jr., was the son of a black minister.
zh: 马丁·路德·金是一位黑人牧师的儿子。

en: Nobody could have guessed, in those days, the place in history that Martin Luther King, Jr. was to have.
zh: 在那个年代，没人能预料到马丁·路德·金会有怎样的历史地位。

en: Miss March gave me an English dictionary.
zh: 马奇小姐给了我一本英语词典。

en: Hurry up, Martin. We're already late!
zh: 快点，马丁。我们已经迟到了！

en: Just put yourself in my shoes.
zh: 你就替我想想吧。

en: Let's just waste some time around here.
zh: 咱们就在这儿打发点儿时间吧。

en: Sit down and take it easy for a while.
zh: 坐下歇会儿吧。

en: Marcia looked grim when I told her the story.
zh: 我把那事告诉玛西娅的时候，她脸色很难看。

en: Marcy burst into tears on hearing the news, but soon pulled herself together.
zh: 玛茜听到消息放声大哭，但很快就振作起来了。

en: Martha is an excellent pianist.
zh: 玛莎是个出色的钢琴家。

en: There will be an in-person meeting of the marketing subcommittee on Tuesday afternoon of Jan 27, 1999 at the San Francisco CA Airport Marriott.
zh: 市场小组委员会将于1999年1月27日周二下午，在旧金山机场万豪酒店举行面对面会议。

en: For your information, the marketing subcommittee is scheduling a phone conference to establish objectives and directions for 1998.
zh: 顺便说一下，市场小组委员会正打算开个电话会议，确定1998年的目标和方向。

en: Scarcely had the market opened when the fire broke out.
zh: 市场刚开门就起火了。

en: Mark is the salt of the earth, so he can be trusted with a secret.
zh: 马克为人特别实在，你可以放心把秘密告诉他。

en: Mark was a work horse on his construction crew.
zh: 马克在建筑队里简直就是个拼命三郎。

en: Mark had never acted on the stage and he was ill at ease.
zh: 马克从来没上过台，所以很不自在。

en: Mark graduated from Harvard in 1991.
zh: 马克1991年从哈佛毕业。

en: What a cute baby! May I hold her?
zh: 这宝宝真可爱！我能抱抱她吗？

en: Margaret is called Meg for short.
zh: 玛格丽特的小名儿叫梅格。

en: Margaret has a talent for music.
zh: 玛格丽特很有音乐天赋。

en: Margaret, whose father you met last Sunday, is a very good tennis player.
zh: 玛格丽特网球打得特别好，你上周日见过她爸爸。

en: Oh no, really?
zh: 噢不，真的吗？

en: I made up my mind to get married to Margaret.
zh: 我决定要和玛格丽特结婚了。

en: I'll tell you what.
zh: 这样吧。

en: Oh, you'll get used to it soon!
zh: 噢，你很快就会习惯的！

en: All in all, this was a nice party.
zh: 总的来说，这次派对挺不错的。

en: Well, just you wait and see.
zh: 行，咱们走着瞧。

en: I sort of like him.
zh: 我还挺喜欢他的。

en: Well, I'll be damned!
zh: 嘿，真是神了！

en: Gosh, what a dirty customer!
zh: 天呐，这家伙可真难缠！

en: Oh, come off it.
zh: 哎呀，得了吧。

en: Oh, it's very kind of you to say so.
zh: 噢，谢谢你这么说。

en: My, but you're nice.
zh: 哎呀，你人真好。

en: Oh, my God!
zh: 我的天呐！

en: Oh, what is this?
zh: 噢，这是什么呀？

en: I guess we could.
zh: 我觉得咱们可以。

en: I'll give it some thought.
zh: 我会考虑一下的。

en: I'm kind of happy.
zh: 我还挺开心的。

en: Boil the milk bottles.
zh: 把奶瓶煮一下消毒。

en: If you drive carelessly, you will miss your turn.
zh: 开车不留神的话，你会错过转弯口的。

en: Don't look away idly; just pay attention to what you're doing.
zh: 别东张西望的，专心干你手里的活儿。

en: If you didn't have your head in the clouds, you could succeed.
zh: 要是你不整天白日做梦，你早就成功了。

en: Hong Myong Bo is a great player.
zh: 洪明甫是个很棒的球员。

en: The pump did not act as it should have.
zh: 泵没正常运转。

en: Mr Hopkins spoke in such a loud voice that I could hear him upstairs.
zh: 霍普金斯先生嗓门儿特别大，我在楼上都能听见。

en: The price of books is getting higher these days.
zh: 最近书价越来越贵了。

en: Can I pay for the book by check?
zh: 买这书我能用支票吗？

en: I missed the train by only one minute.
zh: 我就差了一分钟，没赶上火车。

en: Only a few students understood the matter.
zh: 只有几个学生听懂了是怎么回事。

en: I am only joking.
zh: 我只是在开玩笑。

en: It is nothing but a joke.
zh: 这只不过是个玩笑。

en: Only a handful of people know the fact.
zh: 只有少数几个人知道真相。

en: I need a bit of sugar.
zh: 我需要加点儿糖。

en: Only a few people understood me.
zh: 没几个人能理解我。

en: Give me just a little.
zh: 就给我一点点就行。

en: He is but a child.
zh: 他不过是个孩子。

en: Those books look as if they're going to topple over any minute.
zh: 那些书看着随时都会倒。

en: I don't want to put her to even a small inconvenience.
zh: 我一点儿也不想给她添麻烦。

en: You must give close attention to the merest details.
zh: 你必须注意到每一个微小的细节。

en: It was only an informal party.
zh: 那只是个非正式的聚会。

en: I saw him but once.
zh: 我就见过他一次。

en: Just a spot of shut-eye has already refreshed my mind.
zh: 稍微打个盹儿就让我精神多了。

en: Just a word can do harm to a person.
zh: 哪怕只是一句话也能伤到人。

en: Only a handful of men want to take childcare leave.
zh: 没几个男的愿意休育儿假。

en: Only a few people listened to him.
zh: 没几个人听他的。

en: I am grudged even the least bit of happiness.
zh: 别人连哪怕一点点幸福都舍不得让我拥有。

en: Could I see you a minute, please?
zh: 我能耽误你一分钟吗？

en: It's only a short way, so you can walk there in a few minutes.
zh: 没几步路，走个几分钟就到了。

en: Even the merest little thing irritated him.
zh: 芝麻绿豆点儿的小事都能惹毛他。

en: It only takes a few minutes.
zh: 只要几分钟就行。

en: I saw her just the other day.
zh: 我前两天刚见过她。

en: Only a few members turned up at the meeting.
zh: 开会就只来了几个人。

en: Only fifteen minutes.
zh: 就十五分钟。

en: A person who is only a pawn in the game often talks big in company.
zh: 那些在局里只是个小卒子的人，在外面反而特别爱吹牛。

en: Open the hood.
zh: 把引擎盖打开。

en: He really turns me off.
zh: 他真让我挺反感的。

en: Yeah, it's been a long time.
zh: 是啊，好久不见了。

en: A pound is a unit of weight.
zh: 磅是个重量单位。

en: It is truly regrettable.
zh: 真的很遗憾。

en: It's really coming down out there!
zh: 外面雨下得可真大！

en: You really like comic books, don't you?
zh: 你真的很喜欢漫画书，对吧？

en: You bet I was surprised.
zh: 那肯定啊，我当时可惊讶了。

en: Do you know what it is like to be really hungry?
zh: 你知道真正挨饿是什么滋味吗？

en: It's been quite ages since we last met.
zh: 咱们真的好久没见了。

en: I do hope you will get well soon.
zh: 真希望你早点好起来。

en: Really? What's your special today?
zh: 真的吗？你们今天有什么特色菜？

en: Please connect me with Dr. White.
zh: 请帮我接一下怀特医生。

en: You can meet Dr. White only by appointment.
zh: 怀特医生得预约才能见。

en: Dr. White acted as our interpreter.
zh: 怀特医生给我们当翻译。

en: Mr White punished the boy for cheating on the examination.
zh: 怀特先生因为那个男孩考试作弊惩罚了他。

en: Ms. White spoke slowly enough for me to catch her meaning.
zh: 怀特女士说得挺慢的，我能听懂她的意思。

en: Mr White read out some letters of thanks to his students.
zh: 怀特先生给学生们读了几封感谢信。

en: Ms. White ordered that Tom should stay after school.
zh: 怀特女士让汤姆放学后留下来。

en: Mr White teaches us English.
zh: 怀特先生教我们英语。

en: Mr White is in charge of our class.
zh: 怀特先生管我们班。

en: Mr White is a man of reason.
zh: 怀特先生是个讲道理的人。

en: Mr White wanted to help them.
zh: 怀特先生想帮帮他们。

en: Mr. White said to them, "The room will be $30. $10 for each man." Each man gave him $10 and went up to the room.
zh: 怀特先生对他们说：“房间一共三十块，每人十块。”他们每人给了十块，然后就上楼回房了。

en: Mr White said that because of the convention, there were no rooms available.
zh: 怀特先生说因为开会，没房间了。

en: Mr. White is a liberal politician.
zh: 怀特先生是个自由派政治家。

en: Mr White is doing very well so far.
zh: 怀特先生到目前为止干得挺不错的。

en: Mr White was the manager of a hotel in Springfield.
zh: 怀特先生以前是斯普林菲尔德一家酒店的经理。

en: Mr White has gone to Canada.
zh: 怀特先生去加拿大了。

en: Mr White has gone to India.
zh: 怀特先生去印度了。

en: Mr White called his assistant over and said the following:
zh: 怀特先生把助手叫过来，说了这么几句话：

en: Mr White arrives in Tokyo at 10:30.
zh: 怀特先生十点半到东京。

en: Mr White seems to have many friends.
zh: 怀特先生的朋友好像挺多的。

en: I suggest that you see Mr White.
zh: 我建议你去找一下怀特先生。

en: Mr White and I are not friends, only acquaintances.
zh: 我和怀特先生算不上朋友，也就是认识。

en: Mr White appeared for him in court.
zh: 怀特先生在法庭上为他出庭。

en: Professor White published his first book last year.
zh: 怀特教授去年出版了他的第一本书。

en: White bread, please.
zh: 麻烦给我白面包。

en: White was denounced to the police as a spy.
zh: 怀特被人向警察告发说他是间谍。
